excerpts: My favorites so far are the Sutter breakfast wrap with ham, Swiss, and sun dried tomatoes, or the Turkey Cran sandwich.
Such a nice little surprise to find right down the street from my hotel.. definitely made my trip that much nicer!
sutter breakfast wrap.author: Jeramiah C.
sutter breakfast wrap.review: Just a tiny little hole-in-the-wall, but everything here is quite delicious. My favorites so far are the Sutter breakfast wrap with ham, Swiss, and sun dried tomatoes, or the Turkey Cran sandwich. Such a nice little surprise to find right down the street from my hotel.. definitely made my trip that much nicer!

excerpts: I got the smoked salmon bagel which was absolutely divine.
It was super flavorful and was wrapped perfectly!
My friends got the breakfast burrito and chicken sandwich.
smoked salmon bagel.author: Jasmin G.
smoked salmon bagel.review:
This cafe is wonderful. It is affordable and the food is fresh and delicious.

I got the smoked salmon bagel which was absolutely divine. It was super flavorful and was wrapped perfectly! My friends got the breakfast burrito and chicken sandwich. Both were excellent as well.

I will definitely be coming back here and recommend it to anyone looking for a quick bite! Great for both breakfast and lunch.

excerpts: Hugely satisfying smoked salmon bagel, probably the best I've ever had.
Served with a smile.
smoked salmon bagel.author: Martin H.
smoked salmon bagel.review: Hugely satisfying smoked salmon bagel, probably the best I've ever had. Served with a smile.

excerpts:
*Smoked salmon bagel ($7.50): with Gina Marie cream cheese, tomato, onion, capers on an everything bagel

When I ordered my bagel, the guy asked me if I wanted coffee and hash browns.
smoked salmon bagel.author: Elena N.
smoked salmon bagel.review:
I was starving and craving a bagel and lox. After Yelping for places near work, I found Sutter Street Cafe. It's actually located in the same building as my eye doctor and dentist. Just walk into the building and make a right before the elevators. Then you'll see Sutter Street Cafe on your left. On Tuesday, September 29th around 10:15am, I grabbed take out for breakfast.

*Smoked salmon bagel ($7.50): with Gina Marie cream cheese, tomato, onion, capers on an everything bagel

When I ordered my bagel, the guy asked me if I wanted coffee and hash browns. I said no cuz all I really wanted was the bagel. But the girl that rung me told me they have a complimentary 12oz cup of organic coffee and hash browns with orders over $5.50 between 7am and 11am. So if you ordered something over $5.50 in that time window, grab your free coffee and hash browns. Once I realized they were free, I did!

For the price, the bagel had a good amount of smoked salmon. They also toasted it nicely and put a lot of cream cheese in it. The capers cut into the smoked salmon well and the tomatoes gave it a good freshness.

Great place to grab a bagel and lox in the morning. Just don't forget your free coffee and hash browns if you go between 7am and 11am!

excerpts: The three orders were breakfast burrito (very good and satisfying), smoked salmon bagel (amazing) and smoked turkey sandwich (superb and filling - 7.50$).
Excellent value for money, good ingredients, tasty coffee and a service with a smile.
I really like them, and will be their regular customer going forward.
smoked salmon bagel.author: Balu V.
smoked salmon bagel.review: After three meals at this little place, I have to say 5 stars. The three orders were breakfast burrito (very good and satisfying), smoked salmon bagel (amazing) and smoked turkey sandwich (superb and filling - 7.50$). Excellent value for money, good ingredients, tasty coffee and a service with a smile. I really like them, and will be their regular customer going forward.

excerpts: The little shop doesn't look like much, but this is the best f*cking smoked salmon bagel I've ever had.
smoked salmon bagel.author: Liam M.
smoked salmon bagel.review:
Go inside the building and look for the small sign pointing down the side hall that says "Deli."

The little shop doesn't look like much, but this is the best f*cking smoked salmon bagel I've ever had.

excerpts: I ordered the smoked salmon bagel.
I asked for an onion bagel, but got an everything instead.
smoked salmon bagel.author: Justin M.
smoked salmon bagel.review:
Found this place through Yelp. I ordered the smoked salmon bagel. I asked for an onion bagel, but got an everything instead. The bagel was supposed to be toasted, but could have been a bit warmer and crunchier. 

They give you a complimentary 12 oz coffee and hash brown with every order over $5.50, which was pretty nice. They were friendly, attentive, and fairly quick. 

Overall, it was a good experience, but I've had better bagel sandwiches.

excerpts: I was tempted by some other reviewer's comments about the smoked salmon bagel so that's what I got, and it was great!
smoked salmon bagel.author: Ron C.
smoked salmon bagel.review:
Tiny, unpretentious, old-fashioned, friendly, delicious. All the previous positive reviewer's are correct. 

It is hard to find so look for it by the address as it is inside the lobby of an office building. 

I was tempted by some other reviewer's comments about the smoked salmon bagel so that's what I got, and it was great! 

To top it all off it is a great bargain - eight dollars for a toasted bagel with cream cheese tomatoes and lox with a hash brown patty and coffee.

excerpts: I usually get the smoked salmon bagel, which comes with a cup of coffee and hash browns.
Perfect combination of salmon, Gina Marie cream cheese, tomatoes, and capers.
The place does get pretty packed in the morning, so beware if you're running late!
smoked salmon bagel.author: Sandy W.
smoked salmon bagel.review: Hidden underneath all the medical offices is this great cafe. Convenient for those who have an appointment in the building. The owner is friendly and constantly busy. I usually get the smoked salmon bagel, which comes with a cup of coffee and hash browns. Perfect combination of salmon, Gina Marie cream cheese, tomatoes, and capers. The place does get pretty packed in the morning, so beware if you're running late!

excerpts: Ordered the Mac and cheese and the Sutter sampler(French toast and sausages).
The sampler was good, but the Mac and cheese was GREAT!
Good coffee and awesome spicy Bloody Mary.
Fast and great service
toast.author: Tannaz B.
toast.review: Got a recommendation from someone from our hotel so decided to try it out.    Ordered the Mac and cheese and the Sutter sampler(French toast and sausages).  The sampler was good, but the Mac and cheese was GREAT!   Good coffee and awesome spicy Bloody Mary.    Fast and great service

excerpts: I had their #2 on the menu, 2 eggs, toast, and bacon (you get a choice of meat).
Whole grain toast tasted good, bacon tasted good too
and it was thick.
This place doesn't stand out, it's tucked away next to a parking garage inlet with the entrance in a business building lobby
so it took me a second to find it.
I sometimes favor breakfast places like this that don't P.T.
Barnum their presence.
toast.author: Gerard E.
toast.review: Good breakfast, good price. Three little tables and a counter, this place is good for grabbing something to eat on the go or a quick touch and go breakfast. Coffee was pretty damn good. Strong like I usually make it. I had their #2 on the menu, 2 eggs, toast, and bacon (you get a choice of meat). Whole grain toast tasted good, bacon tasted good too and it was thick. This place doesn't stand out, it's tucked away next to a parking garage inlet with the entrance in a business building lobby so it took me a second to find it. I sometimes favor breakfast places like this that don't P.T. Barnum their presence.

excerpts: What would make them an amazing sandwich place is if they sauced it up a bit, provided a dill pickle with their sandwiches and served bread that wasn't toast slices but rather something... a little more interesting?
Oh, and BTW - the black bean sandwich has got a little bit of spice in it
toast.author: Joanne Y.
toast.review:
I am not a vegetarian, but since I'm on sort of a health kick and I've been looking for some healthier/lighter lunches, I ordered the black bean veggie sandwich based on some other reviewers' recommendations.

It was very flavorful and the sandwich was maybe an inch and a half thick. Pretty good portion and a decent price (about $8ish after tax). While it was very good, it wasn't mind-blowing for a sandwich. It's your average sandwich, slightly better than average for FiDi, and at a slightly better price point. What would make them an amazing sandwich place is if they sauced it up a bit, provided a dill pickle with their sandwiches and served bread that wasn't toast slices but rather something... a little more interesting? Oh, and BTW - the black bean sandwich has got a little bit of spice in it so if you don't like a little spice you may want to stay clear of this one!

The cafe is nestled inside the 450 Sutter building (turn right after you enter). It's got a cool store of candies and snacks that come from Europe, which came somewhat as a surprise to me. It's a pretty decent selection though and I could see myself purchasing some European snacks the next time I swing by for a bite to eat.

Also, I don't know if they're just super fast or if I just happened to beat the lunch rush, but I was in around 11:45am and out by 11:50am. Pretty darn fast.

excerpts: On my first visit I had a "combo" with egg, cheese and bacon on rye toast, plus "hash browns".
The combo was serve as a sandwich and was very tasty.
toast.author: Steve L.
toast.review:
I was staying in the Hyatt across the street and checked Yelp for nearby breakfast places - this turned up, and I'm so glad I did! I went there three times, twice for breakfast (the second time bringing three coworkers) and once for a sandwich.

The cafe, which, somewhat confusingly, is also called the Sutter Street Deli, is under new ownership as of some five months ago. It has a great selection of breakfast items, all made with fresh, and mainly organic, ingredients. On my first visit I had a "combo" with egg, cheese and bacon on rye toast, plus "hash browns". The combo was serve as a sandwich and was very tasty. I also had Greek yogurt, orange juice and simply wonderful coffee, rich and dark, just the way I like it.

The next day I returned and had smoked salmon on a bagel, with tomato, onions and capers. (I asked to hold the cream cheese.) As I expected, I got what I call a "California bagel", a bagel-shaped dinner roll. I have never found what I consider a real bagel (I'm from the northeast) in California. It was tasty, but not really a bagel. Nevertheless, the ingredients were all delicious. My companions had an omelet and some other egg-and-cheese dishes I don't remember exactly. Everyone loved what they got.

That afternoon I returned and ordered a sandwich to go and had a cup of gelato in the store. The gelato was very good as was the sandwich when I had it later. They even threw in a Zone bar at no charge.

The service was very friendly and courteous. The only "problem" I can mention is that because everything is prepared to order, and due to limited space they can make only one thing at a time, it can take a while to receive your order if they are busy. It will be worth it, though!

The cafe also stocks a wide variety of packaged snacks as well as teas, and they have some fresh fruit (I saw bananas and apples) as well.

excerpts: Southwestern sandwich is phenomenal!
Ask for melted cheese/hot sandwich.
The Dutch crunch they use is thinner than most other sandwich spots, which I really liked.
southwestern sandwich.author: Raisa G.
southwestern sandwich.review:
Great spot for quick and fresh sandwiches, coffee, pastries and snacks. They have delicious breakfast all day. 

Southwestern sandwich is phenomenal! Ask for melted cheese/hot sandwich. The Dutch crunch they use is thinner than most other sandwich spots, which I really liked. Who needs the extra carbs 
Generous portions of meat and veggies in sandwiches. 

Great service. Joe, the owner, is polite, professional and fast.

excerpts: Their southwestern sandwich is my favorite here.
It's just the right amount of spicy for me.
It comes on a soft roll
southwestern sandwich.author: Marycruz M.
southwestern sandwich.review:
I discovered this place because I was craving a lox bagel. Saw it had good reviews so I decided to give it a try. It is easy to miss as it is inside of a parking garage. You can also access the cafe through 450 Sutter.

I really enjoyed the lox bagel. It definitely satisfied my craving. Also, if you spend over a certain amount during breakfast hours you receive a complimentary hash brown and coffee. 

Since their lox bagel didn't disappoint, I thought to give their lunch menu a try. Their southwestern sandwich is my favorite here. It's just the right amount of spicy for me. It comes on a soft roll but I usually ask to have it on dutch crunch instead.

Location is small so it can take a while to get your food if it's really busy. I usually try to go before or after the lunch hour rush to avoid waiting.

Friendly staff too!

excerpts: I got the southwestern sandwich and it was great, but a little bit salty.
I got the sandwich to go and then walked to union square to eat outside
southwestern sandwich.author: Elizabeth P.
southwestern sandwich.review: This was an awesome lunch place to stop at after a long flight. I was really hungry and used the great Yelp reviews to find a sandwich for lunch. Ye deli was really cute and the staff was friendly. I got the southwestern sandwich and it was great, but a little bit salty. I got the sandwich to go and then walked to union square to eat outside

excerpts: My favorites so far are the Sutter breakfast wrap with ham, Swiss, and sun dried tomatoes, or the Turkey Cran sandwich.
Such a nice little surprise to find right down the street from my hotel.. definitely made my trip that much nicer!
turkey cran sandwich.author: Jeramiah C.
turkey cran sandwich.review: Just a tiny little hole-in-the-wall, but everything here is quite delicious. My favorites so far are the Sutter breakfast wrap with ham, Swiss, and sun dried tomatoes, or the Turkey Cran sandwich. Such a nice little surprise to find right down the street from my hotel.. definitely made my trip that much nicer!

excerpts: I usually get the turkey cran sandwich -- the meat is tasty and I like the veggies thrown into it.
They spread the cranberry sauce on both sides of the bread (top/bottom) which most other places don't do -- great touch.
turkey cran sandwich.author: Vadim G.
turkey cran sandwich.review:
This is a great spot to get a delicious and light sandwich without paying an arm/leg for it in this area of SF.  Bread is very light and fresh.  I usually get the turkey cran sandwich -- the meat is tasty and I like the veggies thrown into it. They spread the cranberry sauce on both sides of the bread (top/bottom) which most other places don't do -- great touch. The staff has always been super friendly!

They have a fridge selling Fiorello's gelato which I keep trying to try but haven't.

As others have said, seating is limited, but you can grab a sandwich here and walk down 1 block to Union Square and eat in the sunshine.

excerpts: I stop by for a Turkey Cran sandwich whenever I get the chance.
They also have free wifi!
turkey cran sandwich.author: Christopher S.
turkey cran sandwich.review:
Great little deli for this area. Prices are appropriate.
The wait for a sandwich can sometimes be a tad long but the food quality is great.
I stop by for a Turkey Cran sandwich whenever I get the chance.
They also have free wifi!

excerpts: I get the vegan sandwich and it's tasty, the bread is also at the sweet toasted spot that I like.
vegan sandwich.author: Lyla P.
vegan sandwich.review:
I recently started working at the Color Factory just up the hill from this place and I always forget to bring lunch/dinner, and this place has been awesome and convenient because I can order ahead of time with yelp and pick it up during my ten minute break to have it ready for my thirty minute break. 

I love that it's hidden in a building and is small and cozy. It's got a nice ambiance that most cafes don't have. I feel welcomed and comfortable here unlike other cafes where you feel anxious by the busyness of other patrons and the hipster-ness of the decor.  

The chai lattes are so good and always at that temperature where you can finally sip a hot drink right when you get it. (I mean c'mon, this is just great attention to detail!) $3 for a 12 oz and a couple cents more for 16oz 

I get the vegan sandwich and it's tasty, the bread is also at the sweet toasted spot that I like. 

I also recently noticed they sell breakfast all day and the hashbrowns are $1.15 each, so I tried some of them, too. 10/10 

Honestly, I come here each time and order food thinking I'm going to spend a bunch of money on very little food and am surprised each time how cheap it actually is. 

I love this place. I don't know. It's worth my dollar.

excerpts: I usually come for the $7.99 Vegan Sandwich, which is well put together with lettuce, tomato, cucumber and artichoke hearts on wheat (photo: http://bit.ly/1meF6fM).
I've never asked them what spread they use on the sandwich (i'm guessing a soy-based mayo substitute)
but I like it a lot.
When I feel a bit more indulgent, I go for their same-priced BLT since they use Applewood Smoked Bacon
(photo: http://bit.ly/1QANQKu).
These are not culinary creations of the highest order, but they do hit the spot when I need something fast.
There are a couple of tables and a small counter if you want to eat in, but it crowds quickly so you may want to reconsider as several regular customers appear to hang out for long periods in here.

, well packed
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...definitely feels like a former pharmacy
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...usually prompt though a bit slower the last couple of times
TOTAL - 4 stars...you can't knock a solid vegan sandwich...even if they don't know my name
vegan sandwich.author: Ed U.
vegan sandwich.review:
I have to confess that I only come here whenever I have an appointment with my doctor in the building and only if I happen to be in need of a quick bite before getting back to the office. I know that isn't a particularly compelling reason, but I think it says something that I'm willing to stick around 450 Sutter to get a sandwich when I should be acting more like a bat out of hell after seeing my doctor. It's a relatively modest operation although there are quite a few people who work in this tight space at any given time. It appears to operate as a combination deli and convenience store for those who know it's there - patients, medical office staff, parking lot attendants, lost tourists.

I usually come for the $7.99 Vegan Sandwich, which is well put together with lettuce, tomato, cucumber and artichoke hearts on wheat (photo: http://bit.ly/1meF6fM). I've never asked them what spread they use on the sandwich (i'm guessing a soy-based mayo substitute) but I like it a lot. When I feel a bit more indulgent, I go for their same-priced BLT since they use Applewood Smoked Bacon (photo: http://bit.ly/1QANQKu). These are not culinary creations of the highest order, but they do hit the spot when I need something fast. There are a couple of tables and a small counter if you want to eat in, but it crowds quickly so you may want to reconsider as several regular customers appear to hang out for long periods in here. This may be the Cheers of 450 Sutter.

FOOD - 4 stars...good sandwiches, well packed
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...definitely feels like a former pharmacy
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...usually prompt though a bit slower the last couple of times
TOTAL - 4 stars...you can't knock a solid vegan sandwich...even if they don't know my name

excerpts: Based on that first positive experience, I then tried the vegan sandwich.
I specifically asked for the Dutch Crunch Bread to be toasted.
It wasn't.
vegan sandwich.author: Roy C.
vegan sandwich.review:
Based on reading Yelp reviews, I had a craving for a BLT and tried theirs.  It was pretty good.  My only recommendation is that they should use bigger pieces of lettuce as the small pieces they use tend to fall out of the sandwich.  I would go back for the BLT.

Based on that first positive experience, I then tried the vegan sandwich.  I specifically asked for the Dutch Crunch Bread to be toasted.  It wasn't.  On top of that, the overall flavor was just so-so, and not worth a special trip.

Finally, after seeing it mentioned a few times, I tried the Southwestern Chicken Sandwich.  Again, just so-so.  To provide the heat, they add several slices of jalapeno in the sandwich.

The people were nice.  Since it's a big building, they have a loyal and captive clientele.  However, except for the BLT, I haven't found a reason to go back.

excerpts: The grilled bread has a delicate crunch, and my vegan sandwich has ripe avocado, crisp cukes, fresh arugula, yummy artichoke hearts, perfectly roasted red peppers (not slimy!) and savory hummos.
Did I mention the bread?
I can't belive I'm staring at an empty plate.
vegan sandwich.author: Martha R.
vegan sandwich.review:
This tiny spot attached to a parking garage could be mistaken for a convenience counter in a gas station. But it's 3pm, people keep streaming in, and I just devoured the best sandwich I've ever had. 

The grilled bread has a delicate crunch, and my vegan sandwich has ripe avocado, crisp cukes, fresh arugula, yummy artichoke hearts, perfectly roasted red peppers (not slimy!) and savory hummos. Did I mention the bread? I can't belive I'm staring at an empty plate. My consolation is the refrigerator case of artisan gelato in the corner, and the case of fresh pastry by the register.

Seems I only review places I love, so I wanted to break the pattern and give Sutter Street Cafe 4 stars--but there is nothing to complain about. It's spotless, has all-day breakfast, and serves responsibly sourced ingredients. Doesn't seem fair to ding them for their size: only 3 tables (I was lucky to snag one) and only 3 counter seats. And the parking garage... it adds to the pleased-with-myself joy at finding this place.

excerpts: I got the vegan sandwich, which had avocado, artichoke hearts, cucumber, roasted peppers, arugula, and hummus on dutch crunch.
My sandwich was OK
-- I thought it was a little bland.
I wish there were some jalapenos, pepperoncinis, or pickles, although I'm sure that is possible if you ask.
The dutch crunch was a little too chewy for my liking and wasn't baked enough.
Although I wasn't wow-ed by my sandwich, I really appreciated that they had a vegan option on their menu!
I am not vegan but trying to adopt a more plant-based lifestyle and it's great to see restaurants catering to all types of eaters.
I also really like that on top of their menu, it states that they only use sustainably farmed meat with no antibiotics, no growth hormones, and vegetarian fed meats on all of their sandwiches.
I'd definitely like to come back and try the other sandwiches.
vegan sandwich.author: Hana K.
vegan sandwich.review: I was walking back to work from my periodontist's office and wanted to grab a quick bite. I found Sutter St. Cafe on Yelp and decided to try it out after reading the great reviews. This place is a little hard to find initially, but there are signs that guide you to the deli from the entrance of the parking garage. I got the vegan sandwich, which had avocado, artichoke hearts, cucumber, roasted peppers, arugula, and hummus on dutch crunch. My sandwich was OK -- I thought it was a little bland. I wish there were some jalapenos, pepperoncinis, or pickles, although I'm sure that is possible if you ask. The dutch crunch was a little too chewy for my liking and wasn't baked enough. Although I wasn't wow-ed by my sandwich, I really appreciated that they had a vegan option on their menu! I am not vegan but trying to adopt a more plant-based lifestyle and it's great to see restaurants catering to all types of eaters. I also really like that on top of their menu, it states that they only use sustainably farmed meat with no antibiotics, no growth hormones, and vegetarian fed meats on all of their sandwiches. I'd definitely like to come back and try the other sandwiches.

excerpts: Ordered the vegan sandwich, said they usually use a bread that contains cheese.
How is this vegan then????????
vegan sandwich.author: Jenny T.
vegan sandwich.review: Ordered the vegan sandwich, said they usually use a bread that contains cheese. How is this vegan then????????

excerpts: Excited to come back soon to try some of the breakfast items and the Niman ranch pulled pork sandwich... that is, if I can resist not ordering the Sutter St. Special!
niman ranch pulled pork sandwich.author: Ashley S.
niman ranch pulled pork sandwich.review:
This review is for the Sutter St. Special Sandwich: prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, lettuce, arugula, tomato, extra virgin olive oil and 18-year old balsamic on a german pretzel. 4.5 stars. How surprisingly, delightfully, unassumingly delicious. 

Honestly, that's how I'd describe this small hole-in-the-wall shop too, hidden in the 450 Sutter Garage. So no excuses for anyone who says they can't find parking around here ;)

Everyone who works here is also so incredibly nice, and they also stock a pretty impressive selection of chips. Excited to come back soon to try some of the breakfast items and the Niman ranch pulled pork sandwich... that is, if I can resist not ordering the Sutter St. Special!

On second thought, I think the move would actually be to order half of each. No. Just one of each...Yeahhhh.....

excerpts: Try the Niman ranch pulled pork sandwich and you'll be back for me.
niman ranch pulled pork sandwich.author: Jenny L.
niman ranch pulled pork sandwich.review:
If you don't mind a small, cozy mom and pop shop hidden in a garage, it's a great place for sandwiches.  Try the Niman ranch pulled pork sandwich and you'll be back for me.  Service is friendly, fast, and helpful.  

If you're meeting someone, be sure to let them know the following:
- It's tucked inside a building and garage.
- Don't confuse it with Sutter Cafe at 300 Sutter St.

excerpts: I ordered 1/2 Niman Ranch pulled pork sandwich which tasted like pure sugar.
I think someone must have spilled a sugar container in the pork or on something in the sandwich.
I took another bite thinking maybe it was only on the portion I bit into -
not so.
I threw the rest out.
I then went on to the 1/2 tuna sandwich I ordered.
That too had a sugary taste to it but more concerning is that the tuna didn't taste or smell fresh.
I'm disappointed.
niman ranch pulled pork sandwich.author: Sandra P.
niman ranch pulled pork sandwich.review: Considering all the other reviews, my experience today must be a fluke. I ordered 1/2 Niman Ranch pulled pork sandwich which tasted like pure sugar. I think someone must have spilled a sugar container in the pork or on something in the sandwich. I took another bite thinking maybe it was only on the portion I bit into - not so. I threw the rest out. I then went on to the 1/2 tuna sandwich I ordered. That too had a sugary taste to it but more concerning is that the tuna didn't taste or smell fresh. I'm disappointed.

excerpts: I had the organic egg salad sandwich on toasted sourdough roll.
I have to say
, it was the best egg sandwich I've ever had.
The cafe was a little tricky to find.
You have to go inside the entrance next to the Wells Fargo ATM.
organic egg salad sandwich.author: Regie C.
organic egg salad sandwich.review: I had the organic egg salad sandwich on toasted sourdough roll. I have to say, it was the best egg sandwich I've ever had. The cafe was a little tricky to find. You have to go inside the entrance next to the Wells Fargo ATM.

excerpts: Free coffee and hash brown with your meal before 11.
hash brown.author: sungheui u.
hash brown.review: Great sandwiches, great customer service, (and great snack selection lol.) Free coffee and hash brown with your meal before 11.

excerpts: The Smoke Salmon Bagel is awesome...and they offer you free coffee and a free hash brown.
Great food & excellent service!
hash brown.author: T L.
hash brown.review: The Smoke Salmon Bagel is awesome...and they offer you free coffee and a free hash brown. Great food & excellent service!

excerpts: Also, if you spend over a certain amount during breakfast hours you receive a complimentary hash brown and coffee.
hash brown.author: Marycruz M.
hash brown.review:
I discovered this place because I was craving a lox bagel. Saw it had good reviews so I decided to give it a try. It is easy to miss as it is inside of a parking garage. You can also access the cafe through 450 Sutter.

I really enjoyed the lox bagel. It definitely satisfied my craving. Also, if you spend over a certain amount during breakfast hours you receive a complimentary hash brown and coffee. 

Since their lox bagel didn't disappoint, I thought to give their lunch menu a try. Their southwestern sandwich is my favorite here. It's just the right amount of spicy for me. It comes on a soft roll but I usually ask to have it on dutch crunch instead.

Location is small so it can take a while to get your food if it's really busy. I usually try to go before or after the lunch hour rush to avoid waiting.

Friendly staff too!

excerpts: I got the breakfast sandwich combo that comes with a hash brown
plus you get a free small coffee (good coffee too!)
from 7-11am if you spend over a certain amount (can't remember, $6.95?).
Not bad for a tasty, quick meal to get you going for the day.
I loved it, and can't wait to try other breakfast options there plus their lunch sandwiches (great variety from what I saw on the menu) as well.
What a find!
hash brown.author: Maile N.
hash brown.review: EaterSF has made me a new fan of this place for great breakfast sandwiches!  I got the breakfast sandwich combo that comes with a hash brown plus you get a free small coffee (good coffee too!) from 7-11am if you spend over a certain amount (can't remember, $6.95?).  Not bad for a tasty, quick meal to get you going for the day.  I loved it, and can't wait to try other breakfast options there plus their lunch sandwiches (great variety from what I saw on the menu) as well. What a find!

excerpts: They give you a complimentary 12 oz coffee and hash brown with every order over $5.50, which was pretty nice.
hash brown.author: Justin M.
hash brown.review:
Found this place through Yelp. I ordered the smoked salmon bagel. I asked for an onion bagel, but got an everything instead. The bagel was supposed to be toasted, but could have been a bit warmer and crunchier. 

They give you a complimentary 12 oz coffee and hash brown with every order over $5.50, which was pretty nice. They were friendly, attentive, and fairly quick. 

Overall, it was a good experience, but I've had better bagel sandwiches.

excerpts: They also have nice loyalty programs like a stamp card, 10% off with gift card (I think), and a free coffee/hash brown with breakfast sandwich purchase.
hash brown.author: Christina R.
hash brown.review:
Not only is the location as convenient as it gets (located in lobby of my office building), the food is genuinely good, at a very reasonable price, and the staff is incredibly warm; not at all what I was expecting from a lobby coffee shop. They also offer a very extensive menu of beverages, food, and imported/high end candy. 

They also have nice loyalty programs like a stamp card, 10% off with gift card (I think), and a free coffee/hash brown with breakfast sandwich purchase.

I'm obsessed with the cold-brew coffee for only $2. It tastes so smooth and delicious, that I find myself visiting at least 2-3 times a week.

excerpts: To top it all off it is a great bargain - eight dollars for a toasted bagel with cream cheese tomatoes and lox with a hash brown patty and coffee.
hash brown.author: Ron C.
hash brown.review:
Tiny, unpretentious, old-fashioned, friendly, delicious. All the previous positive reviewer's are correct. 

It is hard to find so look for it by the address as it is inside the lobby of an office building. 

I was tempted by some other reviewer's comments about the smoked salmon bagel so that's what I got, and it was great! 

To top it all off it is a great bargain - eight dollars for a toasted bagel with cream cheese tomatoes and lox with a hash brown patty and coffee.

excerpts: I've recently starting working at the 450 Sutter Building and my go to for breakfast is the breakfast bagel sandwich with ham, cheese and egg and it comes with a complimentary hash brown and coffee!
They also have delicious salads, a variety of cold and hot beverages, and just all in all a good spot to grab that afternoon craving!
hash brown.author: Jaclyn C.
hash brown.review: A great cafe! I've recently starting working at the 450 Sutter Building and my go to for breakfast is the breakfast bagel sandwich with ham, cheese and egg and it comes with a complimentary hash brown and coffee! They also have delicious salads, a variety of cold and hot beverages, and just all in all a good spot to grab that afternoon craving!

excerpts: but if you spend more than $5.50 you get a complimentary hash brown and 12 oz coffee.
No waiting time.
hash brown.author: Neisy H.
hash brown.review: Great service! Hidden in the parking garage. Portions are a bit small but if you spend more than $5.50 you get a complimentary hash brown and 12 oz coffee. No waiting time.

excerpts: My husband got the breakfast combo which came with a free coffee and a hash brown.
He liked it a lot.
I got the salmon bagel with a hot chai latte.
Everything was great especially the chai latte.
Not even Starbucks can make it any better then them.
In their cafe they had also snacks and chocolate from all over the world where I found my favourite German chips.
Awesomeeee
hash brown.author: Bianca C.
hash brown.review: Great service and great breakfast. I came there with my husband to get breakfast. My husband got the breakfast combo which came with a free coffee and a hash brown. He liked it a lot. I got the salmon bagel with a hot chai latte. Everything was great especially the chai latte. Not even Starbucks can make it any better then them. In their cafe they had also snacks and chocolate from all over the world where I found my favourite German chips. Awesomeeee

excerpts: Ordered the breakfast combo, which came with uncooked ham and a hash brown patty that looked like it was purchased from the grocery store.
We came in based on the 4.5 stars, but I have no idea how they obtained that rating based on my experience.
hash brown.author: Darlene S.
hash brown.review: OK in a pinch, but I would not return deliberately. Ordered the breakfast combo, which came with uncooked ham and a hash brown patty that looked like it was purchased from the grocery store. We came in based on the 4.5 stars, but I have no idea how they obtained that rating based on my experience.

excerpts: The coffee is so good, the AM breakfasts are great, they gave me an extra hash brown to substitute the bread.
The bacon is amazing!
I highly recommend the BLT sandwich toasted :) very professional and friendly staff.
hash brown.author: C T.
hash brown.review: I work in the building and love the convenience of this Cafe. I heard that is used to be "not so good" but now under new management it is fantastic! I only know it to be fantastic...they're so accommodating to my sensitive food issues, if I bring them my own gluten free bread they will make me any sandwich I want,  they're so generous with portion size. The coffee is so good, the AM breakfasts are great, they gave me an extra hash brown to substitute the bread. The bacon is amazing! I highly recommend the BLT sandwich toasted :) very professional and friendly staff.
